note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from 'Church reserveâ€™, Riverine herald (Echuca, Vic), 1 June 1872, p. 2.

p.seg: [The Rev. Mr. Garlick has had the ground in front of the parsonage tastefully laid out in flower beds, and has planted about the reserve a quantity of young trees and shrubs. On Wednesday last a case of suitable plants was received from the Melbourne Botanic Gardens. Had Mr. Garlick applied a month earlier, he could have obtained a more varied supply and older plants; but he has not fared at all badly, and desires to publicly acknowledge his indebted-ness to Baron Von Mueller, who kindly did the best he could under the circumstances.]
